intro: Harrisia hurstii, commonly known as the pink harrisia, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of bright pink flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are reduced to spines, and it produces small, edible fruits that are often consumed by wildlife. The botanical features of Harrisia hurstii make it a unique and resilient plant in its native habitat.
